Final Answer

From the calculations, morphine has only one stable tautomeric form identified by the search workflow: the canonical morphine structure with SMILES CN1CC[C@]23c4c5ccc(O)c4O[C@H]2[C@@H](O)C=C[C@H]3[C@H]1C5

The microscopic pKa calculated for this form are approximately 9.0 for the nitrogen deprotonation and 9.9 for the phenolic deprotonation.

At physiological pH 7.4, this tautomer is the dominant, and the dominant protonation state is the cationic form (protonated on the nitrogen), with approximately 93% population, the neutral form with 6%, and the deprotonated on phenol negligible.

The microscopic pKa values for this tautomer, calculated using rapid mode, are:

- Acidic deprotonation at the phenolic oxygen: pKa ≈ 9.9

At physiological pH 7.4, this tautomer is dominant (only one form identified). The dominant protonation state is the cationic form (protonated on the nitrogen, charge +1), with approximately 93% population.
